description: Fun game.  Needs a few more play-throughs to get all the planet mechanics down.

title: It took me...
description: It took me four games but I've finally broken myself of buying the Tiny Epic games. The enthusiasm of the creators is infectious but none of the four that I got did anything special. Playing them feels not quite like a chore but definitely obligatory in a lot of ways. No one that I've introduced the games to has been excited about any of it - bland art, bland theme, bland components, bland mechanics. Tiny Epic Bland.

description: My first of the Tiny Epic series and I really enjoy the simple solo rules.

title: Liked it a...
description: Liked it at first but it is settling into a meh. I enjoy the solo version but it just isn't doing it for me.

title: Yet again ...
description:
Yet again the "Tiny" is what makes this game so fiddly. There is a great game here and it should just be "normal" size. 

Even though I don't like that the game is smaller it's still a fantastic game, however I highly recommend you getting the Beyond the Black expansion because it really pushes the game to the next level. I wouldn't play without it because it gives you more choices with bad die rolls and makes the game feel more thematic as you explore space trying to stay away from black holes.

The best of the 'Tiny Epic' games.

title: Rising up ...
description: Rising up the ranks every time I play it. I love how the game kicks into overdrive, and every decision gets weightier and weightier as you near the end. My only gripe is that the game always ends way too quickly. There's so many cool planets with cool abilities, but I don't get to use many of them, at least for very long, before the game ends. You don't realize how many points you easily and quickly rack up (remember upgrading your colony gives you points as well), and it can happen pretty fast. Overall, a pretty great game that grows on you, but don't expect to build this massive sprawling empire, the game ends faster than that.

title: It's ok. B...
description: It's ok. Biggest gripe about it is long player turn times. I thought the other players aside from the main player will have things to do cause they can decide what they want with what the main player picks but the main player usually takes a long time deciding what to do with their dice. Led to a longer play time. Maybe it will be better with 2 players.

description: Pure fun that's easy to teach. The solo is great! Very fun at all player counts. Interesting dice mitigation. I wish the planet powers were more useful. As many have said, the player mats should be the size of the box.
